paper_metadata.title: Diagnosis and management of transthyretin familial amyloid polyneuropathy in Japan: red-flag symptom clusters and treatment algorithm
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted genetic variant information for the TTR gene, including penetrance data for affected and unaffected carriers.

patients.demographics: Age <50 years at symptomatic disease onset

individual_records.evidence_sentence: In a study involving 31 Japanese patients diagnosed with systemic wild-type transthyretin amyloidosis at Shinshu University Hospital, CTS was the most common initial symptom.
Patients, n11745825950 Mean ± SD age of onset, years 35.3.

functional_data.summary: TTR gene mutations destabilize TTR, leading to dissociation of tetramers and partial unfolding of resultant monomers.

variants.additional_notes: The Val30Met variant is the most commonly observed mutation associated with neuropathy.
key_quotes: Replacement of valine with methionine at position 30 (ATTR-FAP Val30Met [p.Val50Met]) is the most commonly observed mutation.
Within approximately 10 years of disease onset, progressive organ dysfunction and death occur.

tables_processed.table_caption: ATTR-FAP linked genetic mutations in Japan

extraction_metadata.notes: Data was extracted from the main text and Table 1.
